DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose study demonstrate safety inject Stromal Vascular Fraction ( SVF ) [ contain Adipose Derived Stem Cells ( ADSCs ) ] enrich fat graft region face require enhancement . The safety SVF evaluate throughout course study phase assessment laboratory value , physical examination , adverse event , safety phone call etc .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Study Antria Cell Preparation Process Enhance Facial Fat Grafting With Adipose Derived Stem Cells
DOC.criteria: 1 . Female Male , Age 18 year old 2 . Subjects schedule liposuction facial fat grafting procedure cosmetic purpose 3 . Facial volume defect could treat total graft volume 1mL 50mL 4 . BMI include 23 28 5 . Able understand provide write verbal informed consent 1 . Currently take take NSAIDs within last two week corticosteroid within last six week prior screen 2 . Diagnosis follow medical condition : Active malignancy ( diagnose within 5 year ) , except treat nonmelanoma skin cancer noninvasive insitu neoplasm Active infection Type I Type II Diabetes 3 . Subjects unlikely comply protocol ( e.g. , uncooperative attitude , inability return subsequent visit , dementia , and/or otherwise consider Investigator unlikely complete study ) 4 . Subjects know drug alcohol dependence within past 12 month judge Investigator 5 . Subjects major illness involve renal , hepatic , cardiovascular , and/or nervous system 6 . Subjects elevate kidney and/or liver function 7 . Any disease condition laboratory result opinion investigator may clinically significant render subject inappropriate study procedure ( ) , may alter accuracy study result , increase risk subject . 8 . Subjects lifeexpectancies less 9 month 9 . Subjects know collagenase allergies 10 . Subjects idiopathic druginduced coagulopathy 11 . Pregnant females 12 . On radiotherapy chemotherapy agent 13 . Taking strong CYP450 inhibitor protease inhibitor ( ritonavir , indinavir , nelfinavir , saquinavir ) , macrolide antibiotic ( clarithromycin , telithromycin ) , chloramphenicol , azole antibiotic ( ketoconazole , itraconazole ) nefazodone . 14 . Subjects history keloid hypertrophic scar formation
